observations: 0.4mm case shows severe discrepancy: corr=0.997, max|Δ|=227, sum_ratio=1.10
Peak distance increases with pixel size: 0→0→3.1→3.0 pixels
Sum ratio trends indicate ~10% excess intensity in PyTorch at 0.4mm
Pattern suggests pixel-size-dependent solid angle or omega scaling issue
hypotheses_ranked: 1. Omega solid angle factor: ω=(pixel_size²/R²)·(close_distance/R) may have pixel_size dependency error
2. Pixel coordinate mapping: pix0_vector or detector pixel→lab coordinates may not scale correctly
3. Cache invalidation: Detector geometry may not be fully recalculated when pixel_size changes
4. MOSFLM +0.5 pixel offset: May interact incorrectly with different pixel sizes
5. F/S basis vector scaling: Fast/Slow detector bases may have residual mm units instead of meters
